PacketDefinitions.Description: This file contains all packet definitions for packets which are sent from game client to the game server.

Packet.Name: Ping
Packet.SentWhen: This packet is sent by the client every few seconds. It contains the current "TickCount" of the client operating system and the attack speed of the selected character.
Packet.CausedReaction: By the original server this is used to detect speed hacks.

Packet.Name: PublicChatMessage
Packet.SentWhen: A player sends a public chat message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The message is forwarded to all surrounding players, including the sender.

Packet.Name: WhisperMessage
Packet.SentWhen: A player sends a private chat message to a specific target player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The message is forwarded to the target player.

Packet.Name: LoginLongPassword
Packet.SentWhen: The player tries to log into the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server is authenticating the sent login name and password. If it's correct, the state of the player is proceeding to be logged in.

Field.Name: Username
Field.Description: The user name, "encrypted" with Xor3.

Field.Name: Password
Field.Description: The password, "encrypted" with Xor3.

Packet.Name: LoginShortPassword
Packet.SentWhen: The player tries to log into the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server is authenticating the sent login name and password. If it's correct, the state of the player is proceeding to be logged in.

Field.Name: Username
Field.Description: The user name, "encrypted" with Xor3.

Field.Name: Password
Field.Description: The password, "encrypted" with Xor3.

Packet.Name: Login075
Packet.SentWhen: The player tries to log into the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server is authenticating the sent login name and password. If it's correct, the state of the player is proceeding to be logged in.

Field.Name: Username
Field.Description: The user name, "encrypted" with Xor3.

Field.Name: Password
Field.Description: The password, "encrypted" with Xor3.

Packet.Name: LogOut
Packet.SentWhen: When the client wants to leave the game in various ways.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the LogOutType, the game server does several checks and sends a response back to the client. If the request was successful, the game client either closes the game, goes back to server or character selection.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopSetItemPrice
Packet.Caption: Player Shop - Set Item Price
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to set a price of an item which is inside his personal item shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: The price is set for the specified item. Works only if the shop is currently closed.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopOpen
Packet.Caption: Player Shop - Open
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to open his personal item shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: The personal item shop is opened and the surrounding players are informed about it, including the own player.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopClose
Packet.Caption: Player Shop - Close
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to close his personal item shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: The personal item shop is closed and the surrounding players are informed about it, including the own player.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopItemListRequest
Packet.Caption: Player Shop - Item List Request
Packet.SentWhen: A player opens a shop of another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The list of items is sent back, if the shop of the player is currently open.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopItemBuyRequest
Packet.Caption: Player Shop - Item Buy Request
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to buy the item of another players shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the buyer has enough money, the item is sold to the player. Both players will get notifications about that.

Packet.Name: PickupItemRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to pick up an item which is laying on the ground in the near of the players character.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player is allowed to pick the item up, and is the first player which tried that, it tries to add the item to the inventory. The server sends a response about the result of the request.

Packet.Name: PickupItemRequest075
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to pick up an item which is laying on the ground in the near of the players character.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player is allowed to pick the item up, and is the first player which tried that, it tries to add the item to the inventory. The server sends a response about the result of the request.

Packet.Name: DropItemRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to drop on item of his inventory on the ground.
Packet.CausedReaction: When the specified coordinates are valid, and the item is allowed to be dropped, it will be dropped on the ground and the surrounding players are notified.

Packet.Name: ItemMoveRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to move an item within or between his available item storage, such as inventory, vault, trade or chaos machine.

Packet.Name: ConsumeItemRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to 'consume' an item. This can be a potion which recovers some kind of attribute, or a jewel to upgrade a target item.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server tries to 'consume' the specified item and responses accordingly.

Field.Name: ItemSlot
Field.Description: The inventory slot index of the item which should be consumed.

Field.Name: TargetSlot
Field.Description: If the item has an effect on another item, e.g. upgrading it, this field contains the inventory slot index of the target item.

Field.Name: FruitConsumption
Field.Description: Defines how the fruit is used. Only applies, if the the item is a fruit.

Enum.Name: FruitUsage
Enum.Description: Defines how the fruit is used. Only applies, if the the item is a fruit.

EnumValue.Name: AddPoints
EnumValue.Description: Adds 1~3 stat points to the character.

EnumValue.Name: RemovePoints
EnumValue.Description: Removes 1~9 stat points from the character.

Packet.Name: ConsumeItemRequest075
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to 'consume' an item. This can be a potion which recovers some kind of attribute, or a jewel to upgrade a target item.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server tries to 'consume' the specified item and responses accordingly.

Field.Name: ItemSlot
Field.Description: The inventory slot index of the item which should be consumed.

Field.Name: TargetSlot
Field.Description: If the item has an effect on another item, e.g. upgrading it, this field contains the inventory slot index of the target item.

Packet.Name: TalkToNpcRequest
Packet.Caption: Talk to NPC
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to talk to an NPC.
Packet.CausedReaction: Based on the NPC type, the server sends a response back to the game client. For example, if it's a merchant NPC, it sends back that a merchant dialog should be opened and which items are offered by this NPC.

Packet.Name: CloseNpcRequest
Packet.Caption: Close NPC
Packet.SentWhen: A player closes the dialog which was opened by an interaction with a NPC.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server updates the state of the player accordingly.

Packet.Name: BuyItemFromNpcRequest
Packet.Caption: Buy Item From NPC Request
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to buy an item from an opened NPC merchant.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player has enough money, the item is added to the inventory and money is removed. Corresponding messages are sent back to the game client.

Field.Name: ItemSlot
Field.Description: Item Slot (NPC Store)

Packet.Name: SellItemToNpcRequest
Packet.Caption: Sell Item To NPC
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to sell an item of his inventory to the opened NPC merchant.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is sold for money to the NPC. The item is removed from the inventory and money is added. Corresponding messages are sent back to the game client.

Field.Name: ItemSlot
Field.Description: Item Slot (Inventory)

Packet.Name: RepairItemRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to repair an item of his inventory.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is repaired if the player has enough money in its inventory. A corresponding response is sent.

Field.Name: ItemSlot
Field.Description: Inventory item slot of the target item. If it's 0xFF, the player wants to repair all items - this is only possible with some opened NPC dialogs. Repairing the pet item slot (8) is only possible when the pet trainer npc is opened.

Packet.Name: WarpCommandRequest
Packet.Caption: Warp Command (pre-season 6)
Packet.SentWhen: A player selected to warp by selecting an entry in the warp list (configured in game client files).
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player has enough money and is allowed to enter the map, it's getting moved to there.

Field.Name: WarpInfoIndex
Field.Description: The index of the entry in the warp list.

Packet.Name: EnterGateRequest
Packet.SentWhen: Usually: When the player enters an area on the game map which is configured as gate at the client data files. In the special case of wizards, this packet is also used for the teleport skill. When this is the case, GateNumber is 0 and the target coordinates are specified.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player is allowed to enter the "gate", it's moved to the corresponding exit gate area.

Packet.Name: EnterGateRequest075
Packet.SentWhen: Usually: When the player enters an area on the game map which is configured as gate at the client data files. In the special case of wizards, this packet is also used for the teleport skill. When this is the case, GateNumber is 0 and the target coordinates are specified.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player is allowed to enter the "gate", it's moved to the corresponding exit gate area.

Packet.Name: UnlockVault
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to unlock the protected vault with a pin.
Packet.CausedReaction: The vault lock state on the server is updated. VaultProtectionInformation is sent as response.

Packet.Name: SetVaultPin
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to set a new pin for the vault when it's in unlocked state.
Packet.CausedReaction: The vault pin is set. VaultProtectionInformation is sent as response.

Field.Name: Password
Field.Description: The password of the account, which is required to set a new vault pin.

Packet.Name: RemoveVaultPin
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to remove the pin for the vault when it's in unlocked state.
Packet.CausedReaction: The vault pin is removed. VaultProtectionInformation is sent as response.

Field.Name: Password
Field.Description: The password of the account, which is required to remove the vault pin.

Packet.Name: VaultClosed
Packet.SentWhen: The player closed an opened vault dialog.
Packet.CausedReaction: The state on the server is updated.

Packet.Name: VaultMoveMoneyRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to move money from or to the vault storage.
Packet.CausedReaction: The money is moved, if possible.

Enum.Name: VaultMoneyMoveDirection
Enum.Description: Defines the moving direction of money between inventory and vault.

EnumValue.Name: InventoryToVault
EnumValue.Description: The money is moved from the inventory to the vault.

EnumValue.Name: VaultToInventory
EnumValue.Description: The money is moved from the vault to the inventory.

Packet.Name: LahapJewelMixRequest
Packet.Caption: Jewel Mix (Lahap)
Packet.SentWhen: When a player has the Lahap npc dialog open and wants to combine or disband jewel stacks.
Packet.CausedReaction: If successful, the inventory is updated and the game client gets corresponding responses.

Enum.Name: MixType
Enum.Description: Describes what kind of operation is requested.

EnumValue.Name: Mix
EnumValue.Description: The player wants to mix single jewels into a bundle.

EnumValue.Name: Unmix
EnumValue.Description: The player wants to disband a bundle into single jewels.

Enum.Name: StackSize
Enum.Description: Describes the size of a mixed stack.

Enum.Name: ItemType
Enum.Description: Describes the type of item which is mixed or unmixed.

Packet.Name: PartyListRequest
Packet.SentWhen: When the player opens the party menu in the game client.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player is in a party, the server sends back a list with information about all players of the party.

Packet.Name: PartyPlayerKickRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A party master wants to kick another player from his party, or when a player wants to kick himself from his party.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the sending player is the party master, or the player wants to kick himself, the target player is removed from the party.

Packet.Name: PartyInviteRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A party master wants to invite another player to his party.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the requesting player has no party, or is the party master, a request is sent to the target player.

Packet.Name: PartyInviteResponse
Packet.SentWhen: A player was invited by another player to join a party and this player sent the response back.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the sender accepts the request, it's added to the party.

Packet.Name: WalkRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to walk on the game map.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player gets moved on the map, visible for other surrounding players.

Field.Name: Directions
Field.Description: The directions of the walking path. The target is calculated by taking the source coordinates and applying the directions to it.

Packet.Name: WalkRequest075
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to walk on the game map.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player gets moved on the map, visible for other surrounding players.

Field.Name: Directions
Field.Description: The directions of the walking path. The target is calculated by taking the source coordinates and applying the directions to it.

Packet.Name: InstantMoveRequest
Packet.SentWhen: It's sent when the player performs specific skills.
Packet.CausedReaction: Usually, the player is moved instantly to the specified coordinates on the current map. In OpenMU, this request is not handled, because it allows hackers to "teleport" to any coordinates.

Packet.Name: AnimationRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player does any kind of animation.
Packet.CausedReaction: The animation number and rotation is forwarded to all surrounding players.

Packet.Name: RequestCharacterList
Packet.Caption: Request Character List
Packet.SentWhen: After a successful login or after the player decided to leave the game world to go back to the character selection screen.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server sends the character list with all available characters.

Packet.Name: CreateCharacter
Packet.SentWhen: The game client is at the character selection screen and the player requests to add a new character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks if the player is allowed to create the character and sends a response back.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Description: The name of the character which should be created.

Field.Name: Class
Field.Description: The character class of the character which should be created.

Packet.Name: DeleteCharacter
Packet.SentWhen: The game client is at the character selection screen and the player requests to delete an existing character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks if the player transmitted the correct security code and if the character actually exists. If all is valid, it deletes the character from the account. It then sends a response with a result code back to the game client.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Description: The name of the character which should be deleted.

Field.Name: SecurityCode
Field.Description: A security code (7 bytes long). Some game clients/servers also expect to transmit the account password (up to 20 bytes long) here. In OpenMU, we work with the security here, but are not limiting to a length of 7 bytes.

Packet.Name: SelectCharacter
Packet.SentWhen: The player selects a character to enter the game world on the character selection screen.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player joins the game world with the specified character.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Description: The name of the character with which the player wants to join the game world

Packet.Name: FocusCharacter
Packet.SentWhen: The player focuses (clicks on it) a character with which he plans to enter the game world on the character selection screen.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks if this character exists and sends a response back. If successful, the game client highlights the focused character.

Packet.Name: IncreaseCharacterStatPoint
Packet.Caption: Character - Stat Point Increase
Packet.SentWhen: The player decides to add a stat point to a specific stat type, by pressing a plus-button in the character info menu.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks if a level-up-point is available. If yes, it adds the point to the specified stat type. It sends a response back to the client.

Packet.Name: ClientReadyAfterMapChange
Packet.SentWhen: After the server sent a map change message and the client has initialized the game map visualization.
Packet.CausedReaction: The character is added to the internal game map and ready to interact with other entities.

Packet.Name: SaveKeyConfiguration
Packet.SentWhen: When leaving the game world with a character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server saves this configuration in its database.

Field.Name: Configuration
Field.Description: The binary data of the key configuration

Packet.Name: AddMasterSkillPoint
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to add or increase the level of a specific master skill of the master skill tree.
Packet.CausedReaction: Adds or increases the master skill level of the specified skill, if the character is allowed to do that. A response is sent back to the client.

Packet.Name: HitRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player attacks a target without using a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: Damage is calculated and the target is hit, if the attack was successful. A response is sent back with the caused damage, and all surrounding players get an animation message.

Packet.Name: TargetedSkill
Packet.SentWhen: A player performs a skill with a target, e.g. attacking or buffing.
Packet.CausedReaction: Damage is calculated and the target is hit, if the attack was successful. A response is sent back with the caused damage, and all surrounding players get an animation message.

Packet.Name: TargetedSkill075
Packet.SentWhen: A player performs a skill with a target, e.g. attacking or buffing.
Packet.CausedReaction: Damage is calculated and the target is hit, if the attack was successful. A response is sent back with the caused damage, and all surrounding players get an animation message.

Field.Name: SkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the skill in the skill list.

Packet.Name: MagicEffectCancelRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player cancels a specific magic effect of a skill, usually 'Infinity Arrow' and 'Wizardy Enhance'.
Packet.CausedReaction: The effect is cancelled and an update is sent to the player and all surrounding players.

Packet.Name: AreaSkill
Packet.SentWhen: A player is performing an skill which affects an area of the map.
Packet.CausedReaction: It's forwarded to all surrounding players, so that the animation is visible. In the original server implementation, no damage is done yet for attack skills - there are separate hit packets.

Field.Name: AnimationCounter
Field.Description: Animation counter which acts as a reference to the previously sent Area Skill Animation packet.

Packet.Name: AreaSkillHit
Packet.SentWhen: An area skill was performed and the client decided to hit a target.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server is calculating the damage and applying it to the target. The attacker gets a response back with the caused damage.

Field.Name: HitCounter
Field.Description: A sequential hit counter which should prevent that hits are sent multiple times.

Field.Name: AnimationCounter
Field.Description: A sequential animation counter which acts as a reference to the previously sent Area Skill Animation packet.

Packet.Name: AreaSkill075
Packet.SentWhen: A player is performing an skill which affects an area of the map.
Packet.CausedReaction: It's forwarded to all surrounding players, so that the animation is visible. In the original server implementation, no damage is done yet for attack skills - there are separate hit packets.

Field.Name: SkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the skill in the skill list.

Packet.Name: AreaSkillHit075
Packet.SentWhen: An area skill was performed and the client decided to hit one or more targets.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server is calculating the damage and applying it to the targets. The attacker gets a response back with the caused damage.

Field.Name: SkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the skill in the skill list.

Field.Name: TargetCount
Field.Description: The number of targets which are hit.

Structure.Name: TargetData
Structure.Description: Contains the data of the target

Packet.Name: TradeCancel
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to cancel the trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: The trade is cancelled and the previous inventory state is restored.

Packet.Name: TradeButtonStateChange
Packet.SentWhen: The player presses the trade button.
Packet.CausedReaction: The state change is forwarded to the trade partner. If both players press the trade button at the same time, the server will try to complete the trade by exchanging the items and money.

Packet.Name: TradeRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The player requests to open a trade with another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The request is forwarded to the requested player.

Packet.Name: TradeRequestResponse
Packet.SentWhen: A requested player responded to a trade request of another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: When the trade request was accepted, the server tries to open a new trade and sends corresponding responses to both players.

Packet.Name: SetTradeMoney
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to set an amount of money in the trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: It's taken from the available money of the inventory. If the new money amount is lower than the amount which was set before, it's added back to the inventory. The trade partner is informed about any change.

Packet.Name: LetterDeleteRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to delete a letter.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter is getting deleted.

Packet.Name: LetterSendRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to send a letter to another players character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter is sent to the other character, if it exists and the player has the required money.

Packet.Name: LetterReadRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requests to read a specific letter of his letter list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server sends the requested letter content back to the game client.

Packet.Caption: Guild - Kick Player
Packet.Name: GuildKickPlayerRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A guild member wants to kick himself or a guild master wants to kick another player from its guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player is allowed to kick the player, it's removed from the guild. If the guild master kicks himself, the guild is disbanded. Corresponding responses are sent to all involved players.

Packet.Name: GuildJoinRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player (non-guild member) requests to join a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The request is forwarded to the guild master. There can only be one request at a time. If the guild master already has an open request, a corresponding response is directly sent back to the requesting player.

Packet.Name: GuildJoinResponse
Packet.SentWhen: A guild master responded to a previously sent request.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the request was accepted by the guild master, the previously requesting player is added to the guild.

Packet.Name: GuildListRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A guild player opens its guild menu in the game client.
Packet.CausedReaction: A list of all guild members and their state is sent back as response.

Packet.Name: GuildCreateRequest
Packet.SentWhen: When a player wants to create a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild is created and the player is set as the new guild master of the guild.

Field.Name: GuildEmblem
Field.Description: The guild emblem in a custom bitmap format. It supports 16 colors (one transparent) per pixel and has a size of 8 * 8 pixel.

Packet.Name: GuildCreateRequest075
Packet.SentWhen: When a player wants to create a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild is created and the player is set as the new guild master of the guild.

Field.Name: GuildEmblem
Field.Description: The guild emblem in a custom bitmap format. It supports 16 colors (one transparent) per pixel and has a size of 8 * 8 pixel.

Packet.Name: GuildMasterAnswer
Packet.SentWhen: The player has the dialog of the guild master NPC opened and decided about its next step.
Packet.CausedReaction: It either cancels the guild creation or proceeds with the guild creation dialog where the player can enter the guild name and symbol.

Field.Name: ShowCreationDialog
Field.Description: A value whether the guild creation dialog should be shown. Otherwise, the guild creation is cancelled and the dialog was closed.

Packet.Name: CancelGuildCreation
Packet.SentWhen: The player has the dialog of the guild creation dialog opened and decided against creating a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: It either cancels the guild creation.

Packet.Name: GuildWarResponse
Packet.SentWhen: A guild master requested a guild war against another guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the guild master confirms, the war is declared.

Packet.Name: GuildInfoRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player gets another player into view range which is in a guild, and the guild identifier is unknown (=not cached yet by previous requests) to him.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server sends a response which includes the guild name and emblem.

Packet.Name: ItemRepair
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to repair an item of his inventory, either himself or with the usage of an NPC.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the item is damaged and repairable, the durability of the item is maximized and corresponding responses are sent back to the client.

Field.Name: InventoryItemSlot
Field.Description: The inventory slot of the target item. If it's 0xFF, the player requests to repair all items with the help of an NPC. If it's 8 (Pet slot), using the pet trainer NPC is mandatory, too.

Packet.Name: ChaosMachineMixRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The player has the dialog of the chaos machine open and decided to mix (craft) the items which he put into the chaos machine dialog.
Packet.CausedReaction: Based on the type of mix and it's corresponding success rate, the mix succeeds or fails. The client gets a corresponding response with the created, changed or lost items.

Field.Name: MixType
Field.Description: The identifier which tells the server which kind of mix should be executed.

Field.Name: SocketSlot
Field.Description: The 0-based slot index of the socket at which a seed sphere should be mounted or removed. May only be available for the corresponding mixes, so access with care.

Enum.Name: ChaosMachineMixType
Enum.Description: This enum describes the possible chaos machine mix type identifiers.

EnumValue.Name: ChaosWeapon
EnumValue.Description: Mixes the items to a chaos weapon.

EnumValue.Name: FruitCreation
EnumValue.Description: Mixes the items to a fruit.

EnumValue.Name: GemstoneRefinery
EnumValue.Description: Refines a gemstone to a jewel of harmony.

EnumValue.Name: PotionOfBless
EnumValue.Description: Refines a Jewel Of Bless to a stack of potions of bless.

EnumValue.Name: PotionOfSoul
EnumValue.Description: Refines a Jewel Of Soul to a stack of potions of bless.

Packet.Name: CraftingDialogCloseRequest
Packet.Caption: Close Crafting Dialog
Packet.SentWhen: A player closes the dialog which was opened by an interaction with the chaos machine goblin.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server updates the state of the player accordingly.

Packet.Name: FriendAddRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to add another players character into his friend list of the messenger.
Packet.CausedReaction: A request is sent to the other player. If the player is currently offline, the request will be sent as soon as he is online again.

Packet.Name: FriendDelete
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to delete another players character from his friend list of the messenger.
Packet.CausedReaction: The entry in the friend list is removed. The player is shown as offline in the other players friends list.

Packet.Name: ChatRoomCreateRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to open a chat with another player of his friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: If both players are online, a chat room is created on the chat server. Authentication data is sent to both game clients, which will then try to connect to the chat server using this data.

Packet.Name: FriendAddResponse
Packet.SentWhen: A player received a friend request from another player and responded to it.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the player accepted, the friend is added to the players friend list and both players get subscribed about each others online status.

Packet.Name: SetFriendOnlineState
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to set himself on- or offline.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the state, the player is shown as offline or online in all friend lists of his friends.

Packet.Name: ChatRoomInvitationRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player wants to invite additional players from his friend list to an existing chat room.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player additional gets authentication data sent to his game client. It then connects to the chat server and joins the chat room.

Packet.Name: LegacyQuestStateRequest
Packet.SentWhen: After the player entered the game world with a character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The quest state is sent back as response.

Packet.Name: LegacyQuestStateSetRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to change the state of a quest, e.g. to start or to finish a quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the requested new state, a response is sent back.

Packet.Name: PetCommandRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The player wants to command its equipped pet (raven).

Packet.Name: PetInfoRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The player hovers over a pet. The client sends this request to retrieve information (level, experience) of the pet (dark raven, horse).
Packet.CausedReaction: The server sends a PetInfoResponse.

Packet.Name: QuestSelectRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The client opened an quest NPC dialog and selected an available quests.
Packet.CausedReaction: If the quest is already active, it responds with the QuestProgress. If the quest is inactive, the server decides if the character can start the quest and responds with a QuestStepInfo with the StartingNumber. A character can run up to 3 concurrent quests at a time.

Field.Name: UnknownField
Field.Description: A value between 1 and 3, probably depending on how many quests are already running. Should not be trusted or considered.

Packet.Name: QuestProceedRequest
Packet.SentWhen: After the server started a quest (and sent a F60B message) the game client requests to proceed with the quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The quest state is set accordingly on the server. The next response seems to depend on the quest configuration. Depending on the action of the next quest state, the server will send either a quest progress message (F60C) or again a quest start message (F60B).

Enum.Name: QuestProceedAction
Enum.Description: Describes how to proceed with the specified quest.

EnumValue.Name: AcceptQuest
EnumValue.Description: The quest is accepted and started.

EnumValue.Name: RefuseQuest
EnumValue.Description: The quest is refused and not started.

Packet.Name: QuestCompletionRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The game client requests to complete an active quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks the conditions to complete the quest. If this fails, nothing happens. If all conditions are met, the reward is given to the player and the quest state is set accordingly, so that the player can select to start the next quest. Additionally, the quest completion response message (F60D) is sent to the client.

Packet.Name: QuestCancelRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The game client requests to cancel an active quest.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks if the quest is currently in progress. In this case, the quest state is reset and a response (F60F) is sent back to the client.

Packet.Name: QuestClientActionRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The game client requests to complete a client action, e.g. completing a tutorial.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server checks if the specified quest is currently in progress. If the quest got a Condition (condition type 0x10) for this flag, the condition is flagged as fulfilled.

Packet.Name: ActiveQuestListRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The clients requests the states of all quests, usually after entering the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The list of active quests is sent back (F61A) without changing any state. This list just contains all running or completed quests for each group.

Packet.Name: QuestStateRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The game client requests the state of a specific active quests.
Packet.CausedReaction: The quest state is sent back (F61B) without changing any state, if the quest is currently in progress.

Packet.Name: EventQuestStateListRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The game client requests the list of event quests, usually after entering the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The server may answer with a response which seems to depend if the character is member of a Gen or not. If it's not in a gen, it sends a response (F603).

Packet.Name: AvailableQuestsRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The client opened an quest NPC dialog and requests a list of available quests.
Packet.CausedReaction: The list of available quests of this NPC is sent back (F60A).

Packet.Name: NpcBuffRequest
Packet.SentWhen: The game client requests to get a buff from the currently interacting quest npc. As far as we know, only the Elf Soldier NPC offers such a buff until a certain character level (150 or 220).
Packet.CausedReaction: The server should check if the correct Quest NPC (e.g. Elf Soldier) dialog is opened and the player didn't reach the level limit yet. If that's both the case, it adds a defined buff (MagicEffect) to the player; Otherwise, a message is sent to the player.

Enum.Name: TradeButtonState
Enum.Description: The state of the trade button.

EnumValue.Name: Unchecked
EnumValue.Description: Trade button is not pressed. It means that the trade is not yet accepted by the trader.

EnumValue.Name: Checked
EnumValue.Description: Trade Button is pressed. It means that the trade is accepted by the trader.

EnumValue.Name: Red
EnumValue.Description: This state is only sent to the client. After some seconds the client is changing back to normal Unchecked.

EnumValue.Name: TradeOther
EnumValue.Description: The trading storage of the other player.

EnumValue.Name: Crafting
EnumValue.Description: The crafting storage of the player.

EnumValue.Name: PersonalShop
EnumValue.Description: The shop storage of another player.

EnumValue.Name: InventoryPetSlot
EnumValue.Description: The inventory slot of the pet. That's used when a pet leveled up.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: The pet is in a normal mode, where it doesn't attack.

EnumValue.Name: AttackWithOwner
EnumValue.Description: The pet attacks the same targets as the owner.

EnumValue.Name: AttackTarget
EnumValue.Description: The pet attacks a specific target until it's dead.
